Posted By: ratchet1215 (9/25/2009 12:37:48 PM)

posts.post_content: Correction, the thing making her very playable is jaya ballard who discards to your graveyard for use of one of 3 burn abilities. However, I still prefer the previous version, why? To use this one I have to stack my deck with enough of specific cards to make her ability count, and then she may never get to use it. Chandra nalaar only needs herself, has pretty solid abilities even if you don't use her ultimate, and her ultimate is still devastating. This one is good too, but its far more dependent on the lay out of a deck, much like nissa is, if you don't have any nissa's chosen for example.. well tough luck.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
the only thing actually making her playable is [Pyromancer's Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer's Ascension). at least you only need to keep her alive for 4 turns to win  
  
edit: yes [Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage) is helpful to Chandra, but i was walking about her playability in limited and standard, where only the ascension can help her. i cant honestly see any truely good decks being made in Zendikar limited, its not a set designed to be played alone from what i have scene. there are a few gems, but most of them are just useless or weak. i mean, the best non-broken card i have scene is [Obsidian Fireheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obsidian Fireheart). that isnt to say there arent good cards in the block, they are all just so easy to break decks with, expecially since the "land matters" theme of the block is obviously a strong indication of the best decks should be mono colored.  
  
Maybe a gimp to the cardpool because of Timespiral/Shadowmoor/Lorwyn standard? i know i have some devestating cards from those blocks, but... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: jhimbob (10/10/2009 1:32:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Imagine, early game you got a lot of goblin swarming your opponent, but at some point your opponent should be able to get rid of those goblin ( white got day of judgement, Red got volcanic fallout, earthquake, Black got infest, green can generate at least as many elf and other small creature to clok those, and blue, well blue is blue...)  
  
So what happen when you get stuck, you cast Chandra ablaze, discard 3 card and ram your opponent with all the red instants and sorcery spell that you already unleashed on him. but this time it's all at the same time, other then blue with the new trap that cost 0 to counter all spell on the stack you should be in a good position to win.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Hopefully they'll decide to reprint this version of her instead of her old [Chandra Nalaar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Nalaar) card in the next core set. Though the old Chandra was a strong card, I prefer this version as it allows you some extra utility as she does something other than damage.  
  
Her second ability actually saved me three times at the prerelease. The first game it saved me because it prevented my opponent from playing a Day of Judgment that would've surely been the end of me, and the other two times I didn't have a hand as red never really has a hand in the late-game, and it let me draw a few extra cards, while thinning everyone else and screwing with their tempo a bit. All [Chandra Nalaar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Nalaar) does is damage, and even though she does a lot of it, I still don't like her as much as this card. As stated earlier her second ability won me three games, and though I never used her ultimate at the prerelease, I did use it afterwards at a few casual games, and I found it to be m...
